;;一名妇女走过东京的路边电视屏幕，报道 Johnny & Associates 创始人 Johnny Kitakawa 的去世， 2019年7月
;

;日本艺人经纪公司Johnny & Associates，其已故创始人被指控 ;成功男孩乐队;背后的创造力——已经到来由于与北川的关系而面临更改名称的压力，北川涉嫌滥用职权已经震动了;日本< /a>; 的娱乐世界。

;

;“批评是可以理解的……我们希望以新的名字建立一个新的未来，”东山说，并补充说，粉丝将被邀请为新推出的产品提交名字人才经纪公司。

;

;东山表示，从 10 月 17 日起，现有公司将更名为 Smile-Up。东山最近接替了喜多川的侄女朱莉·藤岛 (Julie Fujishima) 担任总裁。

;

;成立了一个小组为了解决虐待指控，已向 478 名幸存者咨询，其中 325 人已寻求赔偿。付款预计将于 11 月开始。

;

;Fujishima ;本月首次;承认北川虐待了希望成为日本最强大人才经纪公司代言人的新员工，该公司的行为经常出现在电视上

;

;但最初决定保留 Johnny & 的名字。同事们遭到了幸存者和公众的批评，而包括日产和日本航空在内的几家公司;切断或暂停与该机构的商业关系;。

;

;《朝日新闻》上个月进行的一项民意调查该报发现，55% 的受访者支持改名，36% 反对。

;

;关于北川于 2019 年去世，享年 87 岁的指控首次出现在 1999 年的周刊《周刊文春》上。

;

;北川以诽谤罪起诉《文春》并获得损害赔偿，但上诉后部分判决被推翻，东京高等法院于 2004 年裁定该杂志有充分的理由发表这些指控。喜多川的上诉被最高法院驳回。他从未被指控犯罪。

;

;三月份 BBC 纪录片播出后，他的行为再次成为媒体关注的焦点，;掠食者：日本流行音乐的秘密丑闻;。;。接下来的一个月，15 岁时被该机构聘用的 Kauan Okamoto 公开提出了虐待指控，告诉记者他曾被该机构聘用。 theguardian.com/world/2023/apr/12/ohnny-kitakawa-former-j-pop-idol-kauan-okamoto-alleges-sex-abuse-japan-music-mogul">;被北川性侵犯; 15-20次。该机构的其他几位前成员也提出了类似的指控。

; Mon, 02 Oct 2023 13:52:02 +0800 AI Vincent van Gogh talks of ‘mental health struggles’ in Paris exhibitionhttps://www.theguardian.com/artanddesign/2023/oct/02/ai-vincent-van-gogh-talks-of-mental-health-struggles-in-paris-exhibition
;;2023-10-02T05:00:04Z;
;
;;奥赛博物馆最后作品展览上的梵高自画像
;< p>;对于 1890 年去世的人来说，;文森特·梵高; 似乎非常符合 21 世纪的说法。

;

;当被问及为什么要割掉左耳时，艺术家回答说这是一个误解，事实上他只是割掉了“我的耳垂的一部分” 。那么，他为什么要用左轮手枪向自己的胸部开枪，造成伤害并在两天后死亡呢？

;

;“这仍然是历史学家和专家们猜测的话题。即使对我来说，我动机的真实性仍然是个谜。感谢您理解我的心理健康问题。”他说。

;

;这是人工智能梵高，是艺术家最后作品展览的一部分。 ;巴黎奥赛博物馆;，其中还包括基于他最后的作品的虚拟现实体验

;

;1890 年 5 月，梵高抵达巴黎以北 30 公里处的瓦兹河畔奥维尔村，靠近他的弟弟西奥，并受到保罗·加歇 (Paul Gachet) 医生的照顾。他是“治疗忧郁症”的专家。

;

;在最后的创作狂潮中，他在短短两个月内创作了 74 幅油画和 33 幅素描，其中包括瓦兹河畔奥维尔著名的教堂、肖像画等。加歇和医生的女儿玛格丽特的画作，以及他的最后一幅画布《Les Racines》（根），是在他开枪自杀前 36 小时完成的。

;

;正是这些作品，大部分由奥赛博物馆和阿姆斯特丹梵高博物馆此前从未借过这些作品，这是首次组装。

;

;展览策展人伊曼纽尔·科奎利 (Emmanuel Coquery) 表示：“在这个独特的展览中，我们看到了令人惊叹的各种作品。绘画。这项工作意义重大，因为这是他结束生命的时期。每个人都问的问题是为什么，答案是我们不知道。他是否觉得自己已经完成了自己的全部作品，还是这是一场比他更大的终极危机？

;
;

;;相关：;;在早期绘画后面发现了隐藏的梵高自画像;

; < /aside>;

;“我们还想打破这位被诅咒的艺术家的神话，他死后不被爱，也不被认可。当时他正处于全面的提升之中，他的画作已经开始出售，他也得到了认可。”

;

;科奎利说，梵高的最后一幕似乎是有预谋的，结局并不是因为危机而促成的，而是平静的。

;

;“他在生命的最后几天画了这么多非凡的画作，真是非同寻常。”

; ;

;在进入展览之前，参观者将被邀请参加由博物馆保存并在展览中展出的基于艺术家最后的调色板的互动体验。

;

;“它为游客提供了一种看待艺术的新方式，”来自巴黎的 Chloé Jarry 说道 ;Lucid Realities;，与 ;Vive Arts; 和奥赛博物馆共同制作了互动体验。

;

;“我们使用了梵高最后使用的调色板来展示当时的色彩，并添加了他在绘画中使用的笔触来创建虚拟风景。”

;

;“这是第一个奥赛博物馆在展览中提供 VR 体验。”她说。

;

;展览将于周二开幕，一直持续到明年 2 月，展览结束时，参观者可以摆出艺术家的作品科技初创公司 ;Jumbo Mana; 开发的一项功能对人工智能化身提出了质疑，该公司声称其专业是“为历史人物注入生命”。

;
;

;;相关：;;“精神疾病不是一个笑话”：伦敦画廊因梵高的礼物而受到批评;

;
;

;游客在当他完成了他最著名的晚期作品之一《Le Champ de Blé Aux Corbeaux》（《有群鸦的麦田》）的那一刻。他的回答基于科学研究，涉及对画家写的大量信件（主要是写给他的兄弟）的分析，该研究由监督该项目的梵高专家 Wouter van der Veen 进行。

;

;Christophe Leribault，奥赛博物馆馆长表示，这次展览结合了人工智能和虚拟现实体验，开启了一种看待这位“人人都认识”的艺术家的新方式，他将其形容为“一次启示”。

;

;“这是一个非常不寻常和强大的展览，表明尽管他在生命的最后两个月里经历了挣扎，但他继续进行实验，我们看到了各种各样的主题以及他在绘画、画布和框架方面的创造力，”Leribault

;

;“我们有很多梵高的来信。很少有一位艺术家留下了如此多的手稿，并且可以根据这些手稿开发出软件来让梵高回答我们的问题，尽管它当然仍然是一个游戏。通过 VR 体验，我们可以通过艺术家的调色板沉浸在梵高的世界中。

;

;“这一切都为我们提供了多种方式来了解梵高作为一位非常受欢迎的画家。”

; Mon, 02 Oct 2023 13:22:02 +0800 Overlooked black actor may have been most prolific in early British cinemahttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/02/overlooked-black-actor-may-have-been-most-prolific-in-early-british-cinema
;;2023-10-02T05:00:04Z;
;
;;一个戴着小圆眼镜的宽脸黑人对镜头外的东西做出严重反应的特写;

;在 IMDb 上查找演员卢修斯·布莱克（Lucius Blake），你会发现他的名字只有两个官方来源。谷歌一下他，他的存在几乎不存在。但在 25 年的职业生涯中，布莱克自称为“电影艺术家”，出演了 30 多部英国电影，这使他可能成为早期英国电影中最多产的黑人演员。

;

;现在，经过一位电影历史学家的广泛研究后，布莱克的生活和职业生涯被曝光，他说他被抹去的故事远非独一无二。

;

;“卢修斯·布莱克只是数百名被抹去的有色人种之一。输给了英国电影史。”马克·大卫·雅各布斯 (Marc David Jacobs) 说道，他将发表 ;有关该主题的演示; 周一在 BFI Southbank 庆祝黑人历史月。

;

;雅各布斯在观看 1929 年的电影《美国囚徒》时，第一次看到布莱克扮演重要角色，并认为这可能是黑人扮演的第一个角色英国制造的有声电影中的演员。

; ;

;当他开始研究电影档案时，他发现布莱克是一位打工艺术家，曾出演过1928 年至 1952 年间的数十部电影中。其中包括 1920 年代的《理发师陶德》默片、1930 年代的第一部汉默电影、迈克尔·鲍威尔和埃默里克·普雷斯伯格在 1940 年代最不起眼的作品之一，以及西德尼·波蒂埃在 1930 年代的第二部故事片。雅各布斯说，布莱克被忽视的重要因素之一是对早期英国有声电影的忽视。人们常常通过少数知名明星的镜头来记住这一时期，而不是通过其众多丰富的演员阵容来记住这一时期。

;

;“后来的有色人种角色演员从他们的作品中受益匪浅据了解，布莱克在 1928 年至 1938 年间出演了 25 部影片，这是他职业生涯中迄今为止最多产的部分，但只有四部以 DVD 形式发行，”雅各布斯说。

;

;“一部非凡的影片像《诅咒之王》（1936）这样的电影，布莱克在其中与当时广受欢迎的康拉德·维特一起扮演了关键角色，这可能有助于他早期的认可，但自从上一次在早期的电视上放映以来，这部影片在很大程度上陷入了不应有的默默无闻中。 1990 年代。”

; ;

;布莱克 1890 年出生于牙买加，原名埃卢沙·埃比尼泽·布莱克 (Elusha Ebenezer Blake)。最初，他与家人一起从事咖啡种植工作，23 岁时前往美国匹兹堡，在那里他找到了一份劳工、司机、看门人、钢铁工人和机械师的工作。

;

;他在 20 年代前往英国，在那里首次亮相，似乎没有任何表演经验。他的个人生活同样令人着迷，从因谋杀未遂而受到耸人听闻的审判，到五十多岁在伦敦闪电战中担任担架手。

;

;“布莱克还以至少两个其他名字行事， J. Blake 和 Sam Blake，在任何当代电影数据库中，这两个人都还没有与他联系起来，”雅各布斯说。

;

;“他的默默无闻毫不奇怪地导致他被误认为是其他黑人演员……他不幸的是，他在几部获得银幕外荣誉的电影中被错过了现代演员名单，其中包括《河里的老骨头》（1938），这可能是他主演的票房最大的成功影片。”

; ;

;雅各布斯说，布莱克的职业生涯应该放在有声电影第一个十年在英国工作的其他有色人种的更广泛背景下看待。

;

;“虽然这个问题是那个时期的许多角色演员（包括白人演员）所共有的一个问题，但有色人种演员主要出现在这些较小或更不起眼的角色中，因此人们更能敏锐地感觉到他们在该时期大多数历史中的缺席， ”他说。

;

;这位历史学家重点介绍了一些角色演员，例如出现在英国科幻大片和音乐剧中的日本魔术师高濑清 (Kiyoshi Takase)；以及非裔美国歌手伊娃·哈德森 (Eva Hudson)，她在詹姆斯·梅森的第一部电影中与詹姆斯·梅森 (James Mason) 一起解开了谋杀之谜。作家、导演和制片人，格雷西·菲尔兹创作了四部最成功的作品，并成为“可能是第一个获得奥斯卡最佳编剧提名的有色人种”。

;

;“英国最早制作的有声电影的时代仍然存在雅各布斯说：“这是一个基本上未被发现的国家，关于它的良性神话和明显的谎言仍然占主导地位。”

;

;“它的许多公认的智慧之一是，在那个时代，无论是镜头前还是镜头后的人都是白人。但是，作为一名混血儿，我敏锐地意识到，有色人种的演员和创意人员几乎贯穿了英国电影制作的整个历史——事实上，女性以及其他边缘化社区的成员也是如此。”

; Mon, 02 Oct 2023 13:22:02 +0800 Laphonza Butler to fill Dianne Feinstein’s vacant Senate seat, Newsom office sayshttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/oct/02/laphonza-butler-to-fill-dianne-feinsteins-vacant-senate-seat-newsom-office-says
;;2023-10-02T04:39:45Z;
;
;;拉方扎·巴特勒
;

;加利福尼亚州州长加文·纽森将任命拉方扎·巴特勒为民主党战略家兼顾问纽瑟姆办公室发言人表示，卡马拉·哈里斯的总统竞选活动旨在填补黛安·范斯坦之前担任的空缺美国参议院席位。

;

;纽瑟姆选择巴特勒，履行了他的承诺，即在范斯坦的席位上任命一名黑人女性应该开放。然而，他一直面临一些黑人政客和倡导团体的压力，要求他选择已经竞选该席位的著名黑人女议员芭芭拉·李。

;

;巴特勒将成为美国参议院中唯一的黑人女性，也是第一个在众议院公开代表加州的 LGBTQ+ 人士。

;
;

;;相关：;;黛安·范斯坦的历史性职业生涯以悲剧开始，以争议结束;

;
;

;范斯坦，最年长的国会议员和参议院任职时间最长的女性，;救援人员在墨西哥塔毛利帕斯州马德罗城教堂屋顶倒塌后搜寻被困人员。

;

;当局称，墨西哥北部一座教堂的屋顶在周日弥撒期间倒塌，造成至少 9 人死亡、约 50 人受伤，搜救人员深夜在废墟中搜寻幸存者和其他受害者。

;

;官员称，屋顶塌陷时，据信约有 30 名教区居民被困在废墟中。搜索人员在屋顶板下爬行，官员们还带了狗来帮助寻找可能的幸存者。

;

;塔毛利帕斯州警方表示，倒塌时教堂内约有 100 人。

;

; >;国家安全发言人办公室周日晚间表示，已确认有 9 人因倒塌事故死亡，并称此次倒塌可能是由“结构性故障”造成的。

;

;塔毛利帕斯州警方表示，国民警卫队部队已出动、州警察、州民防办公室和红十字会参与了这次行动。

;

;墨西哥主教委员会发表声明说：“我们为悲惨的生命损失和受伤人员一起祈祷.”

; ;

;墙壁似乎没有被向外炸开，也没有任何爆炸迹象，也没有任何其他结构性破坏的迹象。

;

;国家当局分发的照片显示了教堂某些部分长凳顶部的屋顶板。这使得有可能为任何幸存者提供空气空间。

;

;“目前，正在开展必要的工作，以营救仍在废墟下的人们，”阿尔瓦雷斯在录音中说道。 “今天我们正在经历一个非常困难的时刻。”

;

;国家民防办公室发布的视频显示，屋顶的外缘由短木块支撑。

;

;展示了最初的努力，用起重机将教堂中央靠近地面的倒塌屋顶的部分吊起。但该办公室表示，由于现在正在摇摇欲坠的一块楼板可能会倒塌并危及幸存者，因此放弃了抬起屋顶部分的努力。

;

;该视频描述了官员如何恢复手动救援。显然，救援人员用木支柱或液压千斤顶派到了石板下面，以帮助被困在下面的人。经过专门训练的狗也被派往废墟中寻找幸存者。

;

;民防办公室表示，这些狗最初似乎并没有发现幸存者的迹象，因此采用了过去地震中使用过的旧方法：派遣救援队进入废墟中大声喊叫并聆听任何反应的迹象。

;

;国家地震局没有报告任何强度足以在倒塌时造成此类损害的地震活动。也没有立即发生爆炸的迹象。

;;西班牙穆尔西亚三个相邻夜总会发生火灾后失踪人员的朋友和家人。
;

;西班牙三个相邻夜总会发生的火灾造成的死亡人数预计还会上升，救援人员正在废墟中搜寻另外五人，火灾发生后据报失踪。;造成至少13人死亡;。

;

;南部大火-官员称，穆尔西亚东部城镇周日早上 6 点左右在 La Fonda 俱乐部爆发了火灾，然后蔓延到邻近的 Teatre 和 Golden 俱乐部。

;

;关于下落不明人数的报道各不相同。当地报纸，;La Verdad de Mercia; 援引该镇市长 José Ballesta 的话说，据报道有 18 人失踪。该数字可能包括一些已经发现的火灾。

;

;起火原因正在调查中。

; ;

;截至周日晚些时候，仅通过指纹确认了三具尸体的身份。官员们表示，剩余尸体的身份识别可能需要数天时间，因为 DNA 样本必须送往马德里进行处理。

;

;失踪者中有一对夫妇，Jorge 和 Rosa Bajiota，他们是从据《世界报》报道，他和两个朋友在附近的卡拉瓦卡镇（Caravaca）工作。这对夫妇育有三个孩子。

;
;

;;相关：;;西班牙夜总会发生火灾，至少 13 人死亡;

;
;

;当晚陪同他们前往夜总会的一位朋友向她的母亲在火灾中说道：“妈妈，我爱你。我们会死的，妈妈，我爱你。”在背景中，可以听到人们大声喊叫，要求开灯。

;

;目前尚不清楚死者中是否有这名 28 岁的女子，但只有西班牙媒体确认了她的父亲的身份。 Jairo 表示，他没有收到她的任何进一步消息。

;

;Ballesta 表示，建筑物的结构损坏使进入变得非常困难。

; ;

;“What we are doing right now is trying to extract the bodies, secure the area, care for the families, identify them, which isn't easy at all,” Ballesta said.

;

;Officials said four people, two women aged 22 and 25 years old and two men in their forties, were treated for smoke inhalation.

;

;“According to initial information, the fire broke out on the first floor of the nightclub, which has a ground floor and a first floor,” Diego Seral, the national police spokesman told Radio Onda Regional de Murcia.

;

;Eleven of the 13 bodies so far recovered were found on the first floor of la Fonda, while two were found among the rubble on ground floor. The police said the temperature in the night club may have reached between 1,000 and 1,500C, according to La Verdad de Mercia.

;

;One of those missing was Éric Hernández, originally from Nicaragua and who was celebrating his 30th birthday with friends and family including his brother, Sergio, and his mother, Marta, at La Fonda, the paper reported.

;

;A cousin, Walter Hernández, who survived after leaving the group to have a drink on the lower floor, said eight members of the party were missing.

;

;The city declared three days of mourning for those who had died and flags were lowered to half mast outside Murcia's city hall.

;

;Spain's king said he felt “pain and dismay” following “this tragic day in Murcia”, and thanked rescue workers for their “exemplary work”.

;

;Prime minister Pedro Sanchez voiced “solidarity with the victims and relatives of the tragic fire in a Murcia nightclub”.

; Mon, 02 Oct 2023 12:22:02 +0800 Paris-Berlin relations slump is holding up key EU decisions, says German MEPhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/02/paris-berlin-relations-slump-is-holding-up-key-eu-decisions-says-german-mep
;;2023-10-02T04:00:03Z;
;
;;Olaf Scholz watches as Emmanuel Macron takes a seat at the G20 leaders' summit in New Delhi in September.
;

;Poor relations between France and Germany are slowing down key decisions in the EU including deals on defence in Ukraine and trade, an influential German MEP has claimed.

;

;David McAllister, chair of the European parliament's foreign affairs committee and a key figure in the opposition Christian Democrats party, says he is concerned that the lack of contact between the chancellor, Olaf Scholz, and the French president, Emmanuel Macron, is causing delays on key decisions on battle tanks and fighter jets, and a future trade deal with Latin America.

;

;“At the moment we're seeing a remarkable lack of internal coordination between Paris and Berlin. And that is not good,” said McAllister.

;

;He said the Franco-German relationship, long considered the driving force of the EU, was not “everything in Europe” but that without cooperation between the two countries “things don't work”.

;

;“In the end, Paris and Berlin need to agree to smooth things … and this is where I criticise the German government. I don't think we have seen such little cooperation between Paris and Berlin as we are witnessing at the moment,” he added.

;

;The chancellor's predecessor, Angela Merkel, forged a close relationship over the course of 16 years with four French presidents, including Macron, earning her recognition as the EU's de factor leader. Experts agree that the bloc is now missing that strong working relationship.

;

;One of the most “prominent examples”, said McAllister, was the fight to get decisions made on the next-generation European battle tank, an integral part of the main combat system in Ukraine or any other future war zone.

;

;Last month Paris and Berlin promised to make progress by the end of the year after a meeting between the French armed forces minister, Sébastien Lecornu, and his German counterpart, Boris Pistorius, but some think more political momentum is needed to speed up decisions.

;

;McAllister's centre-right party, which was led by Merkel, has spent the past two years in opposition to the coalition led by Scholz's centre-left Social Democrats, the Greens and the neoliberal Free Democrats.

;

;“Anyone who has been following German-French relations for the past decades will agree there are always hiccups, and the most prominent example is that once again we are not moving foward on the development of the European battle tank,” said McAllister in an interview conducted before the defence ministers met.

;

;But he said this was just one example of the weakness in the relationship.

;

;“We do not see any kind of progress on the next, the future aircraft,” he said. Nor is there progress on a trade deal with the Mercosur bloc of Latin American countries, he said.

;

;McAllister cites an August speech in Prague given by the German leader as a reflection of the lack of bonding at the heart of Europe.

;

;“Can you imagine: he spoke for 45 minutes on the future of Europe – especially defence and security – and he doesn't mention France? I mean, with whom will you organise your European defence and security if not with France? France is the leading military force in Europe and the British left us,” said McAllister.

;

;The view is shared in France. Georgina Wright, director of the Europe programme at the Institut Montaigne thinktank in Paris, said: “My view is, yes, relations are strained. Yes, there are key issues that they need to overcome, based on actual policy disagreement and approach. But we shouldn't exaggerate it too much.

;

;“We are in a period of mistrust … but it's nowhere near what happened between the UK and France in 2017 and 2018 in terms of animosity. At the same time, you have to remember the Franco-German relationship is a lot more important than the France-UK relationship,” she said.

;

;“I think in Paris there is a view that Germany just spends too much time talking to itself. So you've got a coalition that's formed … the three parties that are very different, and they're just spending so much time agreeing a new policy [at home] that by the time it gets to Brussels, they haven't had time to discuss it with anywhere else. And actually, that's something I've heard not just from France, but from other member states as well,” added Wright.

;

;“We shouldn't lose sight of that the fact that while they have fundamental disagreements, and different approaches, these two governments speak not only several times a week but across all ministries and all levels,” Wright added.

;

;This week, fault lines in the relationship between Berlin and Rome were also exposed, with Giorgia Meloni writing to protest against Germany's plans to finance two migrant NGOs operating in Italy.

;

;It was likely to have contributed to Italy's decision to withhold agreement from ;a new text on reforms to EU migration laws; at a summit of interior ministers in Brussels last week.

;;2023-10-02T01:17:24Z;
;
;;Actor Tom Hanks
;

;Tom Hanks has warned fans that an ad for a dental plan that appears to use his image is in fact fake and was created using artificial intelligence.

;

;In a message posted to his 9.5 million Instagram followers, the actor said his image was used without his permission. “BEWARE!! There's a video out there promoting some dental plan with an AI version of me. I have nothing to do with it,” ;Hanks wrote over a screenshot of a computer-generated image of himself from the clip;.

;

;The Oscar winner has expressed concerns in the past about the use of AI in film and TV, although he has not shied away from approving digitally altered versions of himself in film.

;

;The 2004 computer-animated Christmas fantasy The Polar Express featured a CGI version of Hanks. He was also de-aged in scenes in 2022 film ;A Man Called Otto.;

;
;

;;Related: ;;How Hollywood writers triumphed over AI – and why it matters;

;
;

;Speaking with British comedian Adam Buxton ;on his podcast on 18 April;, just days before the start of the Hollywood writers' strike, Hanks said of AI: “We saw this coming. We saw that there was going to be this ability to take zeros and ones inside a computer and turn it into a face and a character. Now that has only grown a billionfold since then, and we see it everywhere.

;

;“I can tell you that there [are] discussions going on in all of the guilds, all of the agencies, and all of the legal firms to come up with the legal ramifications of my face and my voice – and everybody else's – being our intellectual property.

;

;“Right now if I wanted to, I could get together and pitch a series of seven movies that would star me in them in which I would be 32 years old from now until kingdom come. Anybody can now recreate themselves at any age they are by way of AI or deepfake technology.”

;

;Hanks told Buxton that AI could allow a fake version of him to continue acting in perpetuity.

;

;“I could be hit by a bus tomorrow, and that's it, but performances can go on and on and on and on. And outside of the understanding that it's been done with AI or deepfake, there'll be nothing to tell you that it's not me and me alone. And it's going to have some degree of lifelike quality. That's certainly an artistic challenge, but it's also a legal one.”

;
;

;;Related: ;;'We're going through a big revolution': how AI is de-ageing stars on screen;

;
;

;The US writers' strike ended last week, with one of the major sticking points being; concerns that unchecked AI could undermine the work of creatives.; The Writers Guild of America approved an agreement with the Alliance of Motion Picture and ;Television; that features restrictions on how AI can be used in film and TV.

;

;However Sag-Aftra – the union representing Hollywood actors – remains on strike, meaning most productions cannot resume. The ;actors' strike; began a few months after the writers' strike, with pay, as well as concern over the use of AI in generating unapproved likenesses of actors, at the heart of the dispute. There are hopes the writers' deal could help usher in a resolution to the Hollywood actors' strike.

;

;In the Robert Zemeckis-directed film Here, set for release next year, Tom Hanks will ;play younger versions of his character using a tool from Metaphysic.; The AI company said it can create “high-resolution photorealistic faceswaps and de-ageing effects on top of actors' performances live and in real time without the need for further compositing or VFX work”.

;;An honour guard marches at a commemoration ceremony for Ukrainian defenders at Lychakiv cemetery on Sunday in Lviv, Ukraine. Joe Biden has urged congressional Republicans to pass a separate Ukraine aid bill.
;

;Joe Biden has pressed congressional Republicans to back a deal to provide more aid to Ukraine, after provisions for Kyiv were left out of a bill to avoid a US government shutdown.

;

;The US president said on Sunday he was “sick and tired” of the political brinkmanship, and that US support for Ukraine could not be interrupted “under any circumstances”. Republicans had pledged to provide Ukraine aid through a separate vote, he said.

;

;Without referring directly to the US bill, Ukraine's president Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Sunday that nothing would weaken his country's fight against Russia, and that no one could “shut down” Ukraine's stability, endurance, strength and courage, echoing a Ukrainian verb often used to refer to power outages caused by Russian attacks. The Ukrainian president's comments were made in a recorded speech released on the Defenders Day holiday.

;
;

;;Related: ;;'Energy war': Ukraine tries to protect electricity supply before winter;

;
;

;Speaking earlier, Biden told reporters: “We cannot under any circumstances allow America's support for Ukraine to be interrupted. I fully expect the speaker to keep his commitment to secure the passage and support needed to help Ukraine as they defend themselves against aggression and brutality.”

;

;Asked if he could trust the Republican House speaker, Kevin McCarthy, to honour deals, Biden said: “We just made one about Ukraine, so we'll find out”, referring to Republican promises of passing a separate bill on the issue.

;

;Officials in Kyiv have sought to reassure the country that US support for their efforts to repel Russian forces remained intact after Congress on Saturday ;passed a stopgap bill that extended government funding for more than a month;, but did not include aid for Kyiv. The United States has been a major supporter of Ukraine, and Biden has sought to rally the world, as well as his own country, to maintain that support.

;

;Ukraine defence minister Rustem Umerov said he had received reassurances about further military assistance in a telephone call with US defence secretary Lloyd Austin. “Secretary Austin assured me,” Umerov wrote in a post on X, using flags in place of country names, that US support to Ukraine “will continue” and that Ukrainian “warriors will continue to have a strong back-up on the battlefield”.

; ;

;Foreign ministry spokesperson Oleg Nikolenko stressed on Facebook that previously approved funds would be unaffected. “Support for Ukraine remains unwaveringly strong in the US administration, in both parties and chambers of the US Congress, and most importantly, among the American people,” he wrote.

;

;On a difficult weekend for Ukraine, the US bill to avert a shutdown came after the parliamentary election success in Slovakia of ;pro-Moscow figure Robert Fico;. He campaigned on a pledge to ;end military aid to Ukraine;, and said on Sunday his position “has not changed” after his party's clear election win. The 59-year-old, whose stance has sparked fears Slovakia will join Hungary and its authoritarian leader ;Viktor Orbán; in challenging the EU's consensus on support for Kyiv, added: “People in Slovakia have bigger problems than Ukraine.”

; ;

;In contrast, European Union foreign policy chief Josep Borrell said during a visit to Kyiv on Sunday that the bloc was “preparing long-term security commitments for Ukraine”.

;

;“Ukraine needs more capabilities & needs them faster,” he said in a statement posted on X. He said he had discussed “continuous EU military assistance” during his first in-person meeting with defence minister Umerov.

;

;Umerov thanked Borrell in a statement on X for “continuous support” and said the meeting was “a starting point for great cooperation”. He said their discussions of EU military aid to Ukraine covered artillery and ammunition, air defence, electronic warfare and long-term assistance programs.

;

;Last month, Biden assured Zelenskiy during a visit to Washington that strong US support for his war to repel Russian invaders would be maintained despite opposition from some Republican lawmakers.
